meanings.definition: To send or convey from one person or place to another.
meanings.sent1: She was transmitting a message to her friend through the phone.
meanings.sent2: The radio tower was transmitting the news to listeners across the city.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be transmitting a secret message to the dog with its meows.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a beacon, transmitting happiness to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse was transmitting its warning light through the stormy night.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or relay information or signals.
meanings.sent1: The TV station was transmitting the live sports event to viewers at home.
meanings.sent2: The satellite was transmitting data back to Earth from deep space.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was transmitting fake news to the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like antennas, transmitting her emotions without a word.
meanings.sent5: The old radio was transmitting crackling music from a bygone era.

meanings.definition: To pass on or communicate something to others.
meanings.sent1: He was transmitting his excitement about the upcoming trip to his friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was transmitting knowledge to her students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was transmitting gossip it overheard in the house.
meanings.sent4: The painting was transmitting a sense of peace and tranquility to all who viewed it.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug was transmitting comfort and love to the grieving friend.
